page.title: 11LOWER DARNFORD-HEDGE SURVEY
page.content: We did a survey of the{hedges}around {Lower Darnford Farm.}We looked at 42 hedges in all. Most of the hedges were made out of a bank of earth and stones with trees planted along the top.23 had been made stockproof with posts and wire.16 were only the remains of hedges with occasional trees growing out of the bank.3 wire fences had no trees.Most of the hedges which were stockproof were on the lower ground where the fields were smaller.Higher up the fields had been opened out for sheep to graze. We looked at one 325m hedge in detail.We found these trees growing there:-{Hawthorn}(55),{Crabapple}(4) {Honeysuckle}(3),{Ash}(2),{Willow}(2), {Beech}(1),{Hazel}(1),{Blackthorn}(1), {Rowan}(1).The Beech tree was massive with a girth of 5m.
